topics.body:
. . . . . . . Shit here comes WWIII

Yeah putin again; well turns out he's eyeing Belarus, Finland and so forth.  I highly doubt finland is just going to let russia do what they did to crimea to them.  Contrary to what people seem to think Finland isn't a pushover; most of their armed forces is on reserve so Putin's probably looking at their active military going, "yolo" and forgetting that they have what 350k in reserve?  Also belarus has I believe somewhere around 60k and 300k in reserve.  That's going to definitely be a war if russia tries to do what they did to crimea.

"I don't want to set the world on fire; I just want to set a flame in your heart"

But in all seriousness what the hell is putin thinking?  The countries he's eyeing has close to a million troops combined(including reserves) and russia has 1.5 million active troops.

I think putin's been playing too much call of duty lately.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533a30786368721ccf420200#post_533a30786368721ccf420200

An old tactic were if you act confident it lowers the moral of the other enemy. You march with lesser numbers but still confident it can drive the enemy to think you're hiding something and that gets them nervous.

And that in and on itself is stupid since you are cornering you're enemy and it's known that when an animal gets cornered, is when they are at their most dangerous.

If anything, he should Re-read "The Art of War".

"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533a35166368721cb7470000#post_533a35166368721cb7470000
Central time zone.
My sleep schedule is normally 4am to 12pm or 6am to 2pm.  I really do not like sunlight at all.  The only way you'll ever get me to come out during the day is either if it's cloudy and dark or you say the words, "I have a swimming pool" otherwise nuh-uh.  Me in direct sunlight = long sleeve overshirt, pants, scarf, sunglasses and a hat to cover everything or umbrella.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533a3b8e6368722b87da0200#post_533a3b8e6368722b87da0200

I haven't found anything to suggest what you're saying is correct. If anything in the most recent conflicts things ended at the re-establishment of the Status Quo with no hard damages wrought, or Russia won. For the most part, Russia was the one to rip Finland from Sweden, and on before then chip away at what influence they had picked up during The Troubles in the Baltic region.

There is no fine example I can find of "Russians being turned to paste" by the Swedes. If this was the case, I would expect a greater range of territorial or political losses on the Russians by Sweden. Instead all I get is a bunch of Tsars/Tsarinas declaring them a minor nuisance as they wrangle with choking the Ottoman Empire to death.

Or just straight up taking over all of Finland and forcing Romanovs onto the Swedish throne as heir apparents.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533a3ce96368726117200000#post_533a3ce96368726117200000
The swedish military has detailed lists of all possible war scenarios against any possible military with the ability to attack and detailed listings of what to do in each scenario.  They even have listing of all structural weak points on bridges and so forth.

Want to use a bridge to get to a city?  Good luck swimming.  Want to use a mountain pass?  Sure hope your soldiers can breath rubble.  Want to use a tunnel that is the only way to get through the mountain for your vehicles?  Sure hope your soldiers aren't claustrophobic cause they'll be there for a very long time.

The only viable option to get large quantities of troops into sweden to conquer them would be to airdrop them, cause otherwise you'd be getting blown up every twenty feet stepping on landmines/IEDs, traps, bouncing betties, claymores, having bridges blown out under you, getting tunnel entrances blown close while you're in it, support beams for buildings blown while you're in them and so forth.

It would be less of a war and russian soldiers having to stop every five feet to disarm a bomb so that the entire bridge won't collapse under them.  You know how the war in afghanistan primarily consists of IEDs blowing up people and the occasional firefight?  Now imagine bombs and landmines everywhere on every surface imaginable.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533a402f63687264a9980100#post_533a402f63687264a9980100

All nation's militaries have a list of contingency plans involving the predicted or possibly invasion plans by a potential rival. That does not more them invincible, since any plan could still be broken with time or simply accommodating for any possible move they could make to stop or slow you.

Bridge down? Send in the heli corp and move men and gear to establish a position to allow engineers to rebuild the bridge, or simply make a spear-head against enemy positions. Replace armor support with air support while the same heli corp moves your tanks around.

Or you know what? Go around the river. Engineer corps exist for a reason, and that reason is to set up a bridge over whatever they may hit in their way. It's to be expected.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@AaronMk":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533a410b6368721708fe0000#post_533a410b6368721708fe0000
Problem 1)If a entire bridge is at the bottom of a river how do you plan to fix that.
Problem 2)If all access points are rigged to blow up how do you plan on getting across via land if the areas that are close enough for you to cross have minefields on the other side?
Problem 3)If the explosives were already laid before you arrived then how would air support disarm the explosives?  Do you plan on shooting them off?
Problem 4)Tunnels would be death traps

Throwing numbers at them hoping they get through doesn't work if they all get blown up anyhow.  That's like telling a battalion of soldiers, "hey there's a minefield in front of us so I figured the best course of action is we all run through and a couple of you should make it to the other side".

I don't normally say this, but you're the worst armchair general cause throwing numbers at enemies doesn't work if the enemy has more bombs under your feet than sand at a beach.

If I was in a military and I saw my buddy walk forwards and get blown up by a mine, then I saw my next buddy walk forwards and get blown up by another mine, then I saw another buddy walk forwards and get blown up by yet another mine I don't think I would walk that way.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

They just can't charge in expecting to take the country.
